website_summaries.verdict: Classic jelly roll pan and cooling rack that's made to last.
pros: High-quality design with aluminized steel and a patented silicone nonstick coating
Corrugated surface improves air flow around food, helping even baking
The included cooking rack has a crosswire design to avoid your goodies slipping through
Comes with a limited lifetime warranty
cons: Needs to be handled with TLC, since the nonstick coating seems delicate

customer_reviews.title: No warranty......
customer_reviews.text: Buyer beware. I bought this pan to cook bacon on. After only 3 months of once a week use the coat began to come off the rack and it was rusting. I attempted to use the lifetime warranty to no avail. This company has so many exceptions to what its warranty I would be suprised if anyone would be successful in getting a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Teolk2

customer_reviews.title: These pans warped in the oven and caused a second degree burn
customer_reviews.text: These pan are not suppose to warp. Thats is the main reason I bought them. Now that my whole arm is all burnt I demand a full refund. Also a replacement with the good pans would be helpful .Made in the USA must stand for something and the sheet pans I got caused painful damage to my right arm.
customer_reviews.author: Loretta K.

customer_reviews.title: Not the same quality, weight, or parts
customer_reviews.text: This rack is half the weight of the one that came with the original pan. I measured the wiring, and it’s also about half the diameter. Cheap, cheap, cheap!
customer_reviews.author: Bitofinger

customer_reviews.title: Makes great bacon.
customer_reviews.text: Makes great bacon, easily fits one pound of bacon on this rack (see my photos). Also have tried it with chicken breasts and the results are awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Docking Bay 94

customer_reviews.title: Looks and feels nice but nonstick chipped out of packaging
customer_reviews.text: Feels heavy/solid for the size, which I suspect will help prevent warping. Seems it sill clean up quite well. However, I’ve only just now unwrapped it from the packaging (delivered today) and the nonstick coating is rubbed off at 4 of the 6 contact points between the sheet and the rack; the other 2 (the center ones) have rough patches started. This despite the rack having been wrapped in additional cardboard during factory packaging. This makes me uneasy as chipping nonstick can be dangerous, and there are now 6 starting points for additional and expedited chipping to occur.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel P. Henry

customer_reviews.title: Extremely thin non-stick coating
customer_reviews.text: What a shame. This would have been a great purchase: the aluminum is nice and thick, and it feels like a sturdy pan that would have lasted many years. But, the non-stick coating is extremely thin. After about 6-7 normal uses, without any excessive temperatures, without using any harsh scrubbers, in deed, without any harsh scrubbing, the coating is flaking off. All this in addition to using a full-size baking mat that covers the entire pan. Disappointed to a very high degree..
customer_reviews.author: Bitofinger

customer_reviews.title: Some sort of finish on it makes it very easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: Thick enough to not warp in the oven. Some sort of finish on it makes it very easy to clean, but be careful to not scrape the finish off. Do not use metal utensils on it.
customer_reviews.author: byrontex

customer_reviews.title: If this is what we manufacture in our country these days...
customer_reviews.text: Price/size, it was too good to be true... So you guys know what people say about a picture vs words. Check for yourself. Washed twice in the dishwasher, and I use natural detergents on an European dishwasher.... The quality of these both, the pan and the rack are terrible. The nonstick coating is extremely non stick, but it falls off too quickly. I can't even imagine the amount of chemicals people are getting out of these. I don't think this is an isolated case, so I am returning this item and switching to steel and aluminum as I should have done in the first place.
customer_reviews.author: Sarasota

customer_reviews.title: Coding coming off of pan, unsafe
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately our pan is already garbage, the coding is coming off of the pan and it is unsafe to use only after about a year. So if you want a pan for home use that is only safe to use for 6 to 11 month this is the pan for you! Unhappy customer on this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Babygirl53719

customer_reviews.title: Great pan for baking bacon in oven.
customer_reviews.text: This is the first baking pan that cooks bacon perfectly. I've purchased baking pans in the past and all of them have a rack with all of the rods going in one direction. This one has a crisscross design that supports the bacon better and allows it to cook evenly. I had no fatty spots on the bacon and it was nice and evenly crisp. The bacon grease was easy to clean up in the pan and after washing it looked as good as new. Definitely recommend this pan.
customer_reviews.author: Mike T

customer_reviews.title: Not completely US made
customer_reviews.text: I bought this pan and rack set because it was made in the US. I'm trying to buy US made cooking items. The pan is made in the US but the rack is made in China. Wish I would of know that!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The best way to cook bacon
customer_reviews.text: It has taken me decades of cooking bacon incorrectly (stove top and microwave) to find the best way...this sheet pan. Cooking bacon on the stove top is messy, splattering up your stove and countertop, plus it's easy to overcook. Using a microwave seems like the best way, but the steam and grease that eventually clog up your microwave after a few years will ruin it. Not to mention, most microwaves vent the fan through the bottom, which horribly stained my granite countertop...so badly, I now have to keep the microwave in that spot to conceal the stain. Baking your bacon is how the restaurants do it and it works so well. I highly recommend this sheet pan.
customer_reviews.author: larrymcj

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Pan
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful pan for oven-roasted vegetables. Works well with oven baked rutabaga fries. The screen eliminates having to turn foods for crisping all around! 🙂 👍🏽 I recommend this item.
customer_reviews.author: Tootsie

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: The pan bent in the oven while I was baking potatoes. It no longer sits straight.
customer_reviews.author: Nhung Lien

customer_reviews.title: Great pan for Breville Air convection oven.
customer_reviews.text: Wanted to use this pan a couple of months before writing a review. It is my first USA nonstick bakeware and won't be my last. So easy to clean but normally use parchment paper or foil underneath the rack just to make it that much easier to clean. Roast vegetable at 450 degrees with super convection on and there has been no warping of pan. Highly recommend this brand when purchasing bakeware.
customer_reviews.author: V. Laney

customer_reviews.title: The very best Pan!!!
customer_reviews.text: ok, this is the best darn pan I ever had and I have mad a solemn promise to myself that I will never spend another dime on any bakeware if it is not made by USA!!! I love! Love! Love! this baking sheet. I order the cookie sheet also and oh my! love it too. It is so well made that you have to own it to see the full beauty of this pan. It's non stick heavy and huge this is my dream pan and everyone in my house knows better to touch it!!!! If you purchase this baking pan you will be just as happy as I am!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Treyray

customer_reviews.title: It arrived with a small dent it in :(
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed. This arrived with with a ding in it. Hopefully it doesn't go all the way through. The pan is large and somewhat heavy to return. I guess I will have to live with it but find receiving a damaged item unacceptable. The wrapping showed no indication of damage so I can only assume it was damaged when wrapped. One of the worst of my purchases in the many years I have been shopping on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Sashi

customer_reviews.title: This is a nice heavy duty pan but
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice heavy duty pan but, my gripe about this pan is it stains and you cannot remove the stain at all! First time I used it, it developed a small stain. Now, having used it multiple times, the stain just adds on to it! Not even the dryer sheets, dishwashing liquid and hot, boiling water soaking can remove those stains!
customer_reviews.author: Virgilio

customer_reviews.title: Warps to Easy
customer_reviews.text: The second time I used my pan in the oven at 400 degrees, I noticed a corners starting to rise up. Now everytime I use it, the corner is up. I am writing this to let everyone know that these may look sturdy, but there not. Also, the small ribs/grooves in the bottom of the pan are a pain to clean, because you are not suppose to use harsh chemicals, green scrubbing pads, or brillo pads. I will look elsewhere for a replacement because USA Pan aren't the quality they say they are
customer_reviews.author: SeaMike

customer_reviews.title: This sheet pan does not remain flat at oven temperature...
customer_reviews.text: I thought this would be a top quality product... It is not. Each time I have use this sheet pan, the heat of the oven causes sheet pan to twist severely. The sheet pan deforms by lifting up one corner as much as two inches. I will return to using my old cheap pans... they stay flat.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Terrible Product
customer_reviews.text: On the first use the coating started to come off. There was no scratching or stirring the pan either. I had to throw awa the dish I was making because I couldn't see where the flakes went and I didn't want anyone to eat the coating. What a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: NL

customer_reviews.title: Not made in USA
customer_reviews.text: Product description misleading. I know other countries produce quality items, but feel the description should not say made in USA if made in China. I can't speak to durability or quality yet. Haven't used it. But I did wash it, and I expect the small grids will be a chore to clean after use. As described: it's not steel; it's aluminum so it has a bit of a grey/used tint from the beginning. Aluminum is prob better for oven use as it conducts heat more evenly than steel. That's the only reason I'm keeping it. I was disappointed when it arrived, but it will probably serve its purpose.
customer_reviews.author: J. Richards

customer_reviews.title: Warps terribly in the oven and the rack was showing rust ...
customer_reviews.text: Warps terribly in the oven and the rack was showing rust after only 2 hand washes. I would have hoped for better quality for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: High quality toaster oven pan
customer_reviews.text: Really very happy about this purchase, as I do a ton of baking in the toaster oven. The Nonstick surface is great. Very sturdy overall. High quality cooling rack also. I have a couple other USA Pan products as well -- they're quickly becoming a preferred brand of mine. Feels like their stuff will last a good long time.
customer_reviews.author: njdw

customer_reviews.title: Warped after first use
customer_reviews.text: For this price point, these pans should not warp. Never put the pan in the dishwasher, never put cold or wet into the oven. Warped upon first use and now warps whenever it gets warm. Good only for chilling items - which is NOT what it was purchased for. Buyer beware - do not buy this pan if you intend to put it into the oven.
customer_reviews.author: mbmirkwood

customer_reviews.title: Cannot clean it to my standards
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a large pan with a rack and this pan fits the order. My main purpose is to use for meats and poultry. We always use cooking spray. I have used at 450 degrees and the pan has not warped. However, I cannot get the pan cleaned to my standards and this is the reason for the low rating. my recollection is that Brillo should not be used on the pan which is my go to cleaning product for other stainless baking pans. Any suggestions on how to get the pan back to its original clean condition are welcome.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Components made in China
customer_reviews.text: USA pans not made in the USA. The rack is made in China. I can’t comment on the performance of the product. I just got it and have not used it yet.
customer_reviews.author: Shay944

customer_reviews.title: Rack NOT made in the USA!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have a number of USA pan products I cherish and use weekly...this rack was not clearly indicated online to be Made in China but upon receiving it I read the label only to find that despite paying domestic manufacturing prices I received an imported Chinese made product. The product seems ok so far but I am disappointed with the intentionally unclear messaging and a feeling of "bait and switch".
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works and cleans up well
customer_reviews.text: I needed some racks for my larger pans so I could bake batches of bacon and oven fry other things and this fit the bill. I bought one to try and a couple more once I saw how well they worked. I was afraid they would be a pain to clean but I haven’t found that to be the case. I’m glad I bought them.
customer_reviews.author: mrswoody

customer_reviews.title: Too Small
customer_reviews.text: This doesn't' fit the pan by the same company. The rack is much too small: almost 2" in one dimension and 1" in the other. This causes it to slide around in the pan too much, and it also wastes a lot of space. The construction and quality otherwise is great, and it does work very well. It's just too small to fit well. I have the larger version of this pan and grate (half-sheet sized, bought together as a set), and they fit perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Gac

customer_reviews.title: Fine Quality, Heavy-Duty Cooking Pan & Rack
customer_reviews.text: First class cooking pan. It has a heavy, hight quality feel and the cooking results are better than I expected. The not-stick coating on both the pan and cooking rack makes clean-up much quicker and the coating is heavy enough that it should last longer than cheaper non-stick pans. You can buy cheaper pans, but this item will likely give good service for years.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen C. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Good sturdy pan with bakeable rack
customer_reviews.text: I got this baking sheet because it had the bakeable cooling rack. I was trying to make matzo pizza, and in years past, the crust would become soggy from moisture. I thought by elevating the crusts, they’d remain nice and crispy, and it lan is extremely sturdy. It’s not thin and flimsy like the cookie sheets you get elsewhere. It also has a corrugated bottom, so I think if you’re making cookies, that’ll help to keep the bottoms crispy and easy to slide off the pan, although I haven’t tried cookies on it yet. The pan is also extra large size. It is a bit pricey, but it met my expectations.
customer_reviews.author: AKN

customer_reviews.title: Cooling Rack Only.
customer_reviews.text: Seller should update description. This is the cooling rack only. My purchase didn’t come with the pan even when it states it does.
customer_reviews.author: Kristine Polonyi

customer_reviews.title: Get this pan!
customer_reviews.text: This is a fabulous pan. Substantial weight, cooks evenly. Perfect for wings, bacon and other items you want to be cooked with circulation around the top and bottom. Ordered two other USA pans after seeing them at my neighbors. Will be replacing all of my pans with USA Bakeware.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie In Bonifay

customer_reviews.title: The cooking was great the clean-up was the best
customer_reviews.text: This past week we used these pans with and without racks for everything from oven bacon to roasted veggies. The cooking was great the clean-up was the best. A little soaking with Dawn, and the sponge did put the sparkle back on the pans and racks. All of this happened at a lake camp setting where the sink is small and the water isn't always hot!
customer_reviews.author: JEM

customer_reviews.title: Poor coating
customer_reviews.text: First use went great. Second use, used as a tray with plain water and the coating wore off before water was even dumped. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: JoMama

customer_reviews.title: Very good!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this as I was looking for a half size sheet pan. The pan is of high quality, and you can tell by the weight of it, which is not flimsy. Haven't had the chance to use it much yet, but so far, I am very happy with it. The rack that comes with it is very useful. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: JK2363

customer_reviews.title: NOT MADE IN USA - MADE IN CHINA
customer_reviews.text: The product description is extremely misleading - I was led to believe this was manufactured in the USA. It says MADE IN CHINA right on the front of the package. It's also cheaply made (surprise).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Almost Perfect
customer_reviews.text: This is a solid, heavy-duty product with a very thick, excellent nonstick coating. The quality of the rack is not as good. It is of a thin quality. It does have a nonstick coating, but it has sharp spots in it that can scratch the nice surface of the pan when you use it. I would recommend having several sizes of this beautiful pan, just skip the rack, or put a silicon liner under the rack when you use it in the pan.
customer_reviews.author: piano girl

customer_reviews.title: The Cadillac of baking sheets
customer_reviews.text: I’m blown away. First nonstick product I’ve used that’s ACTUALLY nonstick. With no assistance from baking spray. Conducts heat fast and even. Very heavy duty. Awesome large size. Terrific value. Wasn’t planning to spend this much but glad I did and worth every penny. We use it for baking frozen foods meant to be fried and meats/veggies that are good grilled when weather is poor for outdoor cooking and pizza. Don’t even actually make cookies. We use the drying rack as a cooking rack. There’s literally nothing you couldn’t use this for that cooks in an oven. I’m most pleased it isn’t staining or getting burn marks!
customer_reviews.author: Kelly M. Pettersen

customer_reviews.title: Allows for even cooking and prevents food from sticking to baking pan
customer_reviews.text: I thought I would give these a try. I have always placed food on top of the pan, but these are a game changer. They do a really good job for even cooking. I spray them quickly with a coat of PAM, then I place a small sheet of aluminum foil under the rack into the underlining pan to catch drippings for easy cleanup. I have cooked fish, wings, fries and roasted carrots/potato's/green peppers on this rack and it cleans up like a breeze. Running the rack under some warm/hot water using a hand brush cleans these racks very well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Heavy Duty
customer_reviews.text: Talk about heavy duty ,If we plan on using these pans on a regular basis,we need to start going to the gym to build up strength . The wire racks have a dual purpose , use a cooling racks for cookies ,for example ,or use with the pan for cooking meatballs which lets them cook all around without the need to open the oven and turn them , saving on gas usage ( as small as it is ,It's still saving )
customer_reviews.author: Fran Manoulian

customer_reviews.title: False advertsing about manufacting this product in the USA
customer_reviews.text: The product description states: "USA Pan is a Bundy family company which has proudly manufactured high quality bakeware and provided jobs in the USA for over 50 years." Upon receipt of this item, I noted that the label states that this product is made in China. So, if there is any truth to the statement written in the description of this product, it certainly does not apply to this item.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea

customer_reviews.title: VERY FLIMSY
customer_reviews.text: Not at all what I expected. It's very light weight and doesn't sit level unless weight is placed upon it. Too bad as I like the other products I have purchased that were sold by this company.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: 1st update. Opening of pan. Do not believe it’s commercial use pan.
customer_reviews.text: Just received and will update more after proper use. However for a commercial item. This appears used already. Has scratches around rim. Has a dent in corner of the bottom side. This is at opening. Have not even used yet. Will try product and update after use. So far I do not think this is a commercial pan. 2nd update to come.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Mixed feelings
customer_reviews.text: This pan is VERY heavy and well made. It's so heavy it's difficult to maneuver in and out of the oven. And with hot grease one doesn't need any issues with that. Also, the bacon I cooked today took way longer to cook. Maybe 15 minutes longer even on the bottom rack. However there is a few minutes savings in clean up as this pan was lickety-split easy. All in all it's a good buy if you do a lot of baking.
customer_reviews.author: Terry Cook

customer_reviews.title: Pitting after just a year.
customer_reviews.text: I've used this pan less than 10 times and it is already pitting, stained, and simply looks awful - see pic attached. My other USA Pans have only been used for baked goods and seem mostly fine (much less pitting) but this one has been used for roasting chicken, turkey, etc. and it seems the oil destroys the coating on the pan. Knowing that I would have opted for a simpler and cheaper stainless pan over this.
customer_reviews.author: Mike in Downingtown

customer_reviews.title: Very Large Baking Pan and Rack
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my wife. She loves the size and the rack. First use was bacon and did not line the pan. It looked pretty bad with burned crusty stuff stuck to it. We thought we are going to have a heck of a time cleaning it, if we hadn't already ruined it. Cleaned up easily and looks like new. Since then, she has used it for a variety of items and still looks new. So yep, we recommend this baking pan and rack.
customer_reviews.author: Greg O

customer_reviews.title: Nice pans but beware they not standard size they will ...
customer_reviews.text: Nice pans but beware they not standard size they will not fit in standard oven
customer_reviews.author: Katherin

customer_reviews.title: Great baking sheet
customer_reviews.text: I like this a lot. The wire rack puts it over the top. So far i've only baked chicken on it. I've fried chicken in oil, but to be safe, I' baked it on the sheet with the wire rack on it. Catches the grease, and the chicken comes out great. I can't wait to try it with some vegetables. The only drawback to this sheet is that it's big! It's great that it's big, and it does it in my oven, but it doesn't fit entirely in the sink. Oh well! It's still pretty easy to clean though.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Far from the older, sturdier racks! Quality compromised!
customer_reviews.text: We had need to replace our older sheet pan bought in 2012 and add another rack, but the older one is FAR SUPERIOR in quality. We need to bring back manufacturing to the US so we can produce quality products again! The new generations won’t understand cause they never have seen the difference! A vintage rack from EBay would be a better buy! Just saying!
customer_reviews.author: Easy delivery

customer_reviews.title: Great pan. Perfect for wings.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this specifically for cooking wings. I have probably cooked a few hundred wings on it and it functioning perfectly. The non-stick is amazing compared to my other grate type pans. I can good 30 wings on this and have the entire thing clean in about 5 minutes. The only thing to be aware of is that this pan is heavy. Some smaller people might want to use two hands while putting this into the oven.
customer_reviews.author: Dustin Cartwright

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE THIS PAN!
customer_reviews.text: This pan was bigger than I thought it would be. It's ok though.. I absolutely love it! It cleans up so easy. I want it to remain like this so I will never use metal utensils or scrubbers on it. Just set it in warm soapy water and gently wipe down.. even baked on wipes right off. The quality of the pan is excellent (even the mesh part).
customer_reviews.author: Solstes

customer_reviews.title: Great versatile pan!
customer_reviews.text: I plan on using this pan with the rack often. I have been oven baking bacon, sausage, etc for years and this is a great way to optimize browning below without the food sitting in the grease. It IS a really big pan, so make sure you measure your internal oven for the appropriate size. Mine fits perfectly! I only wish I would have bought one years ago. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Joyce N.

customer_reviews.title: Do not use aluminum foil on bottom or your screwed.
customer_reviews.text: I never used my convection oven in my kitchen. I bought this for the convection oven and did not read the instructions. I used aluminum foil on the bottom for clean up but I could not clean the stuck on aluminum foil, thus I ruined it. These chicken wings came out perfect. The rack on the pan cleaned easily using a plastic round cleaning tool (I did not use aluminum foil on that). I liked the job it did so much, I bought the smaller one for my wife and myself. Great for indoor picnics.
customer_reviews.author: Truman Capote

customer_reviews.title: These pans are ok
customer_reviews.text: Very heavy..way too heavy to handle with one hand. Nonstick is fine and cleans easily if washed immediately after use. Areas where the baking grid is welded to the feet have developed minor rust even with hand washing. Kind of a pain to wash the grid. My husband likes to use these pans for ribs or bacon and they work well but I’m not in love with them.
customer_reviews.author: Lola

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase. Fits the width of the oven.
customer_reviews.text: High quality sheet pan. Perfect size to fit the whole width of the oven (make sure you measure). This is more sturdy than the sheet pans you buy in the grocery store. Nice and thick. The grate is also good quality and fits well. It does warp a little when you broil, but bounces right back after cool down. I always put foil down. So I can’t really speak to how easy it is to clean if you didn’t take that step, but mine looks like new after several uses.
customer_reviews.author: NoVa

customer_reviews.title: This isn’t even sarcastic. I actually love the hell outt this pan
customer_reviews.text: You know you’ve gotten old and there’s nothing you can do about it when you not only appreciate the quality of a god damn pan but you look forward to actually using it. Life has peaked when you say to yourself, “what the hell was I cooking with a giant pan this whole time when I could’ve been using several smaller ones to do the same Job?!” But not even in a sarcastic way; generally appreciating being able to cook multiple dishes on multiple pans. I can now cook potatoes In 1 pan. Chicken in another and the garden in the others. Plus, these pans are so friggin thick they’re not gonna bend. Score!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very durable pan for cooking!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my mom who wanted a large size pan for her cooking use. She absolutely loves the fact that the pan has a large surface area and sturdy built for the users in the kitchen. Definitely worth the buy for anyone who are looking for very sturdy yet very much great for the use for kitchen overall.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: as advertised
customer_reviews.text: it browns on all sides without turning the food half way through. the grate is easy to clean, the pan is almost impossible to clean. I can't even get it clean with SOS pads. the stains just won't come off. I now place a sheet of aluminum foil under the grate to cut down on the stains and make cleanup easier.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Solid, Big, and the Rack is Handy!
customer_reviews.text: Very nice size. It fits on and fills a whole rack in the oven so you can space out food and lay it evenly. Solid design as well, it feels like it is going to last. The rack is handy as well, not only can it be used for cooling, but when you use it while baking, say, frozen foods for instance; it helps cook more evenly and make for crispier food.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Grommesh

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for cooking bacon in the oven. LOVE THIS PRODUCT!!
customer_reviews.text: I love love love these pans!! We can put 2 full packages of bacon on one pan, and bake it in the oven. All the grease goes in the pan and NOT on your bacon! Easy to clean if you spray them with Pam Spray before applying the bacon. The grease will slide right off! GREAT PURCHASE
customer_reviews.author: Meagan Corlew

customer_reviews.title: Works great for wings, fries, and frozen pizza
customer_reviews.text: I bought this specifically for cooking chicken wings in the oven. I place this in a baking sheet lined with foil and it does a great job making crispy wings, fries, and even frozen pizza.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Great pan for toaster oven
customer_reviews.text: Heavy duty, well made in America pan with great non stick surface. Fits in my toaster oven. Because of its thickness it cooks food to perfection. Will buy more products from this company.
customer_reviews.author: Naiad

customer_reviews.title: USA Pan makes great products!
customer_reviews.text: This is our second purchase of a USA Pan product. The first product we bought were a set of two bread loaf pans. Our high satisfaction with them convinced us to try this pan to replace our largest worn-out baking pan. The sturdiness and quality of construction and materials seem top-notch. The non-stick coating works as advertised (we stay away from max temperature rating and avoid metal utensils and harsh cleaning products on them). The rack has been perfect for cooking bacon. The very large size fits perfectly in our oven. Cleans up magically easy. Great buy! Thinking of buying a couple of the smaller pans too!
customer_reviews.author: Jaames K

customer_reviews.title: I'd buy it again
customer_reviews.text: This is an almost perfect pan. Not lightweight, holding up well, pan is easy to clean. The cooling rack that comes in the deal is, as most, a pain to clean. Unless you spray a non stick product on it or have an area big enough to lay it flat and scrub with brush. Pan seems to be of material and quality that should last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: madonna

customer_reviews.title: Cheap
customer_reviews.text: This is poorly made with thinner than normal wires. There is a coating on the wires but it feels rough in spots. Guess I missed in the description where it was (not) dishwasher safe. It did however say it on the product label. Oh well, should have gone with the heavier stainless steel ones.
customer_reviews.author: Lazybutt

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to my arsenal
customer_reviews.text: I had a full sheet and 2 half sheets so now I also have 2 quarter sheet pans. All the same mfg with the matching racks.
customer_reviews.author: PCarter

customer_reviews.title: Ultimate chicken wings pan! Recipe in review
customer_reviews.text: To me chicken wings are the fifth food group. With this pan, I can indulge anytime, probably too much. Here is the secret... Parchment paper under the rack... Split the wings, toss them in a little baking powder, convection/speed bake @425 for 40 minutes. Sauce them up. Great pan.
customer_reviews.author: RDemeule

customer_reviews.title: Get it
customer_reviews.text: Great sheet pan. Thick and sturdy will not warp in hot oven. It's not non-stick but it is pretty easy to clean, make sure to use appropriate fat to coat. Corrugated bottom ensures even heat and helps with removal of items. Use with silpat and in most instances you won't even have to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Skull cap afficionado

customer_reviews.title: I have used this pan a TON
customer_reviews.text: my wife ordered this for me and I didn't know why. it is fantastic. it's basically non stick and it s good, versatile size. I have used it for cinnamon rolls and just about anything else that I can.
customer_reviews.author: eve

customer_reviews.title: LOVE this pan!
customer_reviews.text: I bake a lot and I have learned that I would rather pay a few more dollars for something and have it last than to buy something made cheap to have to throw it away after a few uses. The pan is very sturdy and I love that it's made in the USA. I will be purchasing more items from this company.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Martin

customer_reviews.title: An awesome professional sheet pan
customer_reviews.text: This is not your mamas cookie sheet! This is commercial grade; this is the bad boy the professionals use. Perfect size for roasting, baking cookies and any oven duties you can come up with. Particularly like the finish on the bottom of the pan. This is something that will be in your kitchen for a very long time.
customer_reviews.author: MV

customer_reviews.title: Measure, measure, measure!
customer_reviews.text: The pan was just a milimeter to big to put in my top oven, but it fit like a glove in the bottom oven. If you have a dual convention oven, just be aware that it might not fit in the top oven. Make sure to measure twice. Perfect for spatchcock turkeys!
customer_reviews.author: drew kohl

customer_reviews.title: More cookies!
customer_reviews.text: This cookie pan/sheet is perfect. It doesn’t require a wax/baking paper or even butter or anything but I like to lay a thin layer of butter just to keep the life of the sheet as good as possible. It’s quite large and takes up the entire width of my stove. Which is great because that means more room for cookies...
customer_reviews.author: Phoebe

customer_reviews.title: Warped in the oven at 425F (only tried so far at this temp)
customer_reviews.text: I had read all these great reviews that this pan didn't warp at high heat. First time I used was to roast veggies at 425 and it most definitely warped. Lame. It flattened out once cooled down but what the heck? Was I not sent the same thing as other customers? It's super duper heavy too so I just don't get it. Thinking that it's not worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Tina N.

customer_reviews.title: We love this pan!
customer_reviews.text: We have been looking for a durable oven rack for a while, and we LOVE this thing. We have used it several times/week since its arrival. Easy to clean, and makes the most delicious potato wedges, butternut squash fries, and chicken wings! We thought about buying an air fryer... but this thing is BETTER! We rarely sign online to write reviews, but the hubby and I agreed- this one deserves 5 stars. We highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Made in USA
customer_reviews.text: Awesome heavy duty pan. Very well built, heavy and sturdy. Non stick has worked so far. The rack is does wonders for things like fries, fish sticks and bacon. No need to flip halfway thru. Quality pan worth the money
customer_reviews.author: Chad Hilton

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, clean easily, don't warp or stain
customer_reviews.text: These pans are the best. I've had one for 8 months, ordered this with the rack for more cooking options. I've used the "old" one mainly for cookies, veggie bakes, and bacon. They are sturdy, don't warp, don't discolor or stain... Even with 400 degree veggie bakes. They clean easily and look like new after 8 months. I highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Mary T. H.

customer_reviews.title: Measure your oven first!
customer_reviews.text: I had to return because I bought the biggest size without measuring... don’t make the same mistake I did! My door would not close because it was way too long. And it was too wide to fit the other direction! Ugh. So I’ll be reordering after I measure!
customer_reviews.author: Laney

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Bacon cooker, easy cleanup
customer_reviews.text: We will use this for other dishes, but this is the easiest way for us to cook bacon for our family. I place parchment paper on pan to catch the bacon grease. before placing rack, . This makes the pan even easier to clean. Bacon slices cook easily on rack, fat drains off into pan. No need to turn bacon, it cooks evenly on both sides since it is cooking in hot air instead of a hot solid surface. No burn spots, and no leftovers! The non-stick coating on both the pan and rack, makes for easy cleanup.
customer_reviews.author: Brother Jimbo

customer_reviews.title: Has a non-stick coating
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with this purchase. I didn't realize it has a non-stick coating that cannot be scoured, but maybe I won't need to scour it. It fits perfectly in the 1/4 sheet pans I purchased at Sam's club. I will most likely order the larger ones as well.
customer_reviews.author: K. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: What I always needed for my Sheet Pan
customer_reviews.text: Perfect accompaniment for a sheet pan. Its great for keeping meat from sitting in its own fat (when that's not what you want), also for keeping pancakes, waffles warm in the oven without soggy bottoms. Of course perfect as a cookie sheet. I already was a fan of the company's products, and definitely will buy from again.
customer_reviews.author: happykbd26

customer_reviews.title: Warped after first use.
customer_reviews.text: Pan warped significantly after first use. It seems very solid, and the non-stick is great, but a warped pan causes so many problems in cooking.
customer_reviews.author: Barry L. Novak

customer_reviews.title: USA Bakeware Products are the best
customer_reviews.text: My USA Pan Bakeable Nonstick Cooling Rack is a first-class product. It is durable, heavy (not too heavy) and works very well. I use it as a cooling rack and a baking rack for food items like turkey & Chicken on a USA half-sheet pan. Highly Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: richard

customer_reviews.title: Super high quality, sturdy, easy to clean.
customer_reviews.text: Very high quality. Super easy to clean. This has become my go to baking sheet. I need to get a half sheet with rack just like this.
customer_reviews.author: real consumer

customer_reviews.title: My favorite baking sheet
customer_reviews.text: This is now my favorite baking sheet for everything. It is not non-stick, so using foil or parchment paper under the rack is advisable. I have a small oven, so I had to measure the inside dimensions of my oven carefully, but this pan fits perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: L. Bello

customer_reviews.title: Easy cleaning
customer_reviews.text: The pan works great. Made of durable material that is easy to clean. The item is diswaher safe. I would have like for it to be a little bigger for the amount you pay. We have made dozens of bacon wrapprd green beans anf asparagus of this pan. The design allows for the bacon and puff pastry to cook even and golden on all sides. I recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Angelique D

customer_reviews.title: Racks scratched pan coating
customer_reviews.text: Pans came scratched from the cooling racks. No protective paper between the rack and pan allowing the rack to scratch the coating off the pan
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic cooling rack!
customer_reviews.text: This cooling rack has grates going both ways so that cookies do not fold in between the rows like my previous rack. well made, love it!
customer_reviews.author: Nan Tibolla

customer_reviews.title: very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: This baking pan with rack is very heavy and sturdy. It's very good quality. I do not like that it's hand wash only. For that reason I don't use it very often, because I hate washing dishes by hand (did it until I was 40 years old). Other than that, the non-stick is wonderful!
customer_reviews.author: Anna O.

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality
customer_reviews.text: Pan and rack are heavyweight and stands up nicely to heat and weight. Cleans very easily with soap and water. Pan almost non stick. I bought all three sizes and they all have seen useful service. I no longer have to decide what pan to use in oven. They are my go to guys.
customer_reviews.author: Hubert F Hamilton

customer_reviews.title: LOVE USA Pans
customer_reviews.text: We have three sizes of this pan and absolutely love them. High quality and durable. We use them for baking cookies and roasting veggies (not at the same time...Hahaha!). They clean up easily and the racks fit perfectly within the pans.
customer_reviews.author: MPK

customer_reviews.title: LOVE this baking sheet
customer_reviews.text: It fits easily in your oven and holds everything! My husband uses it for his one culinary skill...bacon. The cooling rack is very useful for baking when I am NOT using the pan too. It is also heavy duty. Bought one for my daughter and she loves it too for baking and bacon.
customer_reviews.author: Maryland Mom-Mom

customer_reviews.title: They lie in the description, these warp!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these expensive baking sheets because I wanted something that wouldn't warp. These warp so badly that they are almost unusable. They are nice heavy pans and easy to clean. I think I'm just going to try and find some aluminum pans like my old ones. I wouldn't recommend buying these
customer_reviews.author: mike

customer_reviews.title: Very very flimsy
customer_reviews.text: Came bent, but there wasn't time to order a new one. Very flimsy. My cake ended up with a bow in it because the middle sagged so much.
customer_reviews.author: BRS

customer_reviews.title: Good product.
customer_reviews.text: So far I have made Jerky and Bacon on the grill. Both worked out great. I spray Avocado Oil on the pan and grate prior to cooking and clean up is easy. Will set steaks on it to age in the fridge overnite next time.
customer_reviews.author: Joe B.

customer_reviews.title: Best bacon pan ever.
customer_reviews.text: Best bacon pan ever. This does a whole Costco pack.
customer_reviews.author: C. R. Laughlin

customer_reviews.title: Study little baking sheet and rack.
customer_reviews.text: What can I say!!! It’s a USA pan! Everything pan and baking sheet they make in my opinion are the best. This little sheet with the rack is perfect to bake bacon on in the oven. Cleaning is easy and the sheet in firm and strong. Hasn’t warped on me yet. I want all of the USA bakeware items in my kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: Jama

customer_reviews.title: Perfect large sized pan with grate
customer_reviews.text: This has become my first choice cookie baking pan. Holds large number of. Cookies, saving the time of multiple cooking times for smaller pans. Straight from the pan to the cooling grate. I cover with baking sheets so there is virtually no cleaning ! Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: S BROWN

product_meta.title: USA Pan Jelly Roll Baking Pan and Bakeable Nonstick Cooling Rack, Metal
product_meta.description: Style Name:Jelly Roll Pan & Rack SetThe USA Pan nonstick jelly roll pan and non-stick jelly roll cooling rack set includes a 14. 25 x 9. 375 x 1 inch jelly roll pan and a 13. 75 x 8. 625 x 0. 56 inch jelly roll baking & cooling rack. This superb kitchen baking combo is the perfect set for home bakers looking to make freshly baked cookies, cakes, and scones that bake evenly, cool uniformly, and come out tasting great. The USA Pan non-stick jelly roll cooling rack fits seamlessly inside the USA Pan non-stick jelly roll pan and provides home bakers with an easy way to add the perfect glaze or finish to your homemade baked goods. Simply place your oven safe cooling rack in the pan, add your items on top of the cooling rack, and you are ready to start baking like a professional. The cooling rack is easy to use and features a steel cross wire design and 6 raised feet, which elevate your cookies, breads, cakes, and scones into a raised position. This raised position promotes uniform cooling among your baked items. The nonstick coating on both the Jelly roll pan and the cooling rack means that your baked goods will release quickly and easily, leaving your cookie bottoms crispy and intact! Both the Jelly roll pan and the cooling rack are oven safe up to 450 degrees Fahrenheit. Handwashing is the preferred method of cleaning For the Jelly roll pan. The cooling rack is not dishwasher safe and it is recommended that you clean the rack using a soft sponge or kitchen brush to remove food particles. USA Pan professional grade bakeware helps everyday home bakers produce professional grade baked goods. USA Pan bakeware is long-lasting, durable, and reliable. USA Pan is a Bundy family owned company, based in the greater Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania area that has been producing high performance bakeware for over 50 years.
feature_bullets: Classic jelly roll pan and cooling rack for baking and roasting cookies, vegetables, and cakes; commercial grade and heavy gauge aluminized steel
Baking pans feature unique corrugated surface; facilitates air flow for quick release and evenly baked goods; cooling rack has crosswire design and six raised feet for stability and uniform cooling
Nonstick Americoat coating - a patented silicone coating which is PTFE, PFOA and BPA free - provides easy release of baked-goods and easy clean up; wash with hot water, mild soap and gentle sponge
Made with globally sourced materials; rack Dimensions: 13. 75 x 8. 62 x 0. 5 inches; jelly roll baking area Dimensions: 14. 25 x 9. 375 x 1 inches; outer pan Dimensions: 14. 75 x 9. 75 x 1 inches
USA Pan is a Bundy family company which has proudly manufactured high quality bakeware and provided jobs in the USA for over 50 years
